docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Remove nan values

docs.text: MotionSense MotionSense Datasets Guide MotionSense is a dataset for Human Activity Recognition ( HAR ), sampled at 50Hz containing accelerometer and gyroscope data. The following files contains data obtained by 24 subjects. Each record is composed by: Accelerometer Gyroscope Label Subject Weight Height Age Gender Trial x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id weight height age gender trial All data is represented as float64 The dataset file WISDM.npy Label Activity 0 Stairs Dwon 1 Stairs Up 2 Walking 3 Jogging 4 Standing 5 Sitting Import In order to import the dataset, you just need to type: import numpy as np dataset = np.load('MotionSense.npy')
docs.title: MotionSense

docs.text: MotionSense is a dataset for Human Activity Recognition ( HAR ), sampled at 50Hz containing accelerometer and gyroscope data. The following files contains data obtained by 24 subjects. Each record is composed by: Accelerometer Gyroscope Label Subject Weight Height Age Gender Trial x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id weight height age gender trial All data is represented as float64
docs.title: MotionSense Datasets Guide

docs.text: Label Activity 0 Stairs Dwon 1 Stairs Up 2 Walking 3 Jogging 4 Standing 5 Sitting
docs.title: WISDM.npy

docs.text: In order to import the dataset, you just need to type: import numpy as np dataset = np.load('MotionSense.npy')
docs.title: Import

docs.text: PAMAP2 PAMAP2 Datasets Guide PAMAP2 is a dataset for Human Activity Recognition ( HAR ), sampled at circa 100Hz ( 99.63Hz - 99.89Hz ) containing accelerometer, gyroscope and magnetometer data. The following files contains data obtained by a total of 9 subjects. All data is represented as float64 The dataset file Since in each recording the IMU were placed on hand, chest and ankle, there are 3 different datasets files: - PAMAP2-H : referd to the HAND readings - PAMAP2-C : referd to the CHEST readings - PAMAP2-A : referd to the ANKLE readings PAMAP2-*.npy Each record is composed by: Acc. Gyro. Mag. Label Subject Sex Age Height Weight x - y - z x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id sex age height weight Activities Label Activity 0 Lying 1 Sitting 2 Standing 3 Walking 4 Running 5 Cycling 6 Nordic walking 7 Ascending stairs 8 Descending stairs 9 Vacuum cleaning 10 Ironing 11 Rope jumping 12 Other (transient activities) Activities performed by subject Label Subject 0 Subject 1 Subject 2 Subject 3 Subject 4 Subject 5 Subject 6 Subject 7 Subject 8 0 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 1 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 2 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 3 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 4 Y Y - - Y Y Y Y - 5 Y Y - Y Y Y Y Y - 6 Y Y - Y Y Y Y Y - 7 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 8 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 9 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 10 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 11 Y Y - - Y Y - Y Y 12 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y PAMAP2-*-filtered.npy Since Subject 8 is the one with the most activities not performed, it was removed. Furthermore, as suggested by the authors, Activity 12 should not be considered, so it has been removed. The rest of the dataset is unaltered. Import In order to import the dataset, you just need to type: import numpy as np dataset = np.load('PAMAP2-*.npy') # or filtered_dataset = np.load('PAMAP2-*-filtered.npy')
docs.title: PAMAP2

docs.text: PAMAP2 is a dataset for Human Activity Recognition ( HAR ), sampled at circa 100Hz ( 99.63Hz - 99.89Hz ) containing accelerometer, gyroscope and magnetometer data. The following files contains data obtained by a total of 9 subjects. All data is represented as float64
docs.title: PAMAP2 Datasets Guide

docs.text: Since in each recording the IMU were placed on hand, chest and ankle, there are 3 different datasets files: - PAMAP2-H : referd to the HAND readings - PAMAP2-C : referd to the CHEST readings - PAMAP2-A : referd to the ANKLE readings
docs.title: The dataset file

docs.text: Each record is composed by: Acc. Gyro. Mag. Label Subject Sex Age Height Weight x - y - z x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id sex age height weight
docs.title: PAMAP2-*.npy

docs.text: Label Activity 0 Lying 1 Sitting 2 Standing 3 Walking 4 Running 5 Cycling 6 Nordic walking 7 Ascending stairs 8 Descending stairs 9 Vacuum cleaning 10 Ironing 11 Rope jumping 12 Other (transient activities)
docs.title: Activities

docs.text: Label Subject 0 Subject 1 Subject 2 Subject 3 Subject 4 Subject 5 Subject 6 Subject 7 Subject 8 0 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 1 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 2 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 3 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 4 Y Y - - Y Y Y Y - 5 Y Y - Y Y Y Y Y - 6 Y Y - Y Y Y Y Y - 7 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 8 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 9 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 10 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y - 11 Y Y - - Y Y - Y Y 12 Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y Y
docs.title: Activities performed by subject

docs.text: Since Subject 8 is the one with the most activities not performed, it was removed. Furthermore, as suggested by the authors, Activity 12 should not be considered, so it has been removed. The rest of the dataset is unaltered.
docs.title: PAMAP2-*-filtered.npy

docs.text: In order to import the dataset, you just need to type: import numpy as np dataset = np.load('PAMAP2-*.npy') # or filtered_dataset = np.load('PAMAP2-*-filtered.npy')
docs.title: Import

docs.text: SisFall SisFall Datasets Guide SisFall is a dataset for Human Activity Recognition ( HAR ), sampled at 200Hz containing accelerometer and gyroscope data. The following file contains data obtained by a total of 38 subjects: 23 adults (19 - 30 years) and 15 elderly (60 - 75 years) All data is represented as float64 Acquisition details In this document, the following notation is used: - Acc. 0 : refers to accelerometer ADXL345 (± 16g range) - Gyro. : refers to gyroscope ITG3200 (± 2000°/s range) - Acc. 1 : refers to accelerometer MMA8451Q (± 8g range) The dataset file SisFall-original.npy Each record is composed by: Acc. 0 Gyro. Acc. 1 Label Subject Age Height Weight Gender x - y - z x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id age height weight gender Activities Label Activity 0 Walking slowly 1 Walking quickly 2 Jogging slowly 3 Jogging quickly 4 Walking upstairs and downstairs slowly 5 Walking upstairs and downstairs quickly 6 Slowly sit in a half height chair, wait a moment, and up slowly 7 Quickly sit in a half height chair, wait a moment, and up quickly 8 Slowly sit in a low height chair, wait a moment, and up slowly 9 Quickly sit in a low height chair, wait a moment, and up quickly 10 Sitting a moment, trying to get up, and collapse into a chair 11 Sitting a moment, lying slowly, wait a moment, and sit again 12 Sitting a moment, lying quickly, wait a moment, and sit again 13 Being on one's back change to lateral position, wait a moment, and change to one's back 14 Standing, slowly bending at knees, and getting up 15 Standing, slowly bending without bending knees, and getting up 16 Standing, get into a car, remain seated and get out of the car 17 Stumble while walking 18 Gently jump without falling (trying to reach a high object) SisFall-reduced.npy This version differs from the original in the following ways: - Removed subjects: from 32 to 37 - Removed quick activities: 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 17, 18 - Downsampled to 50Hz (linear interpolation used) Each record is composed by: Acc. 1 Gyro. Label Subject Age Height Weight Gender x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id age height weight gender Activities Label Activity 0 Walking slowly 1 Jogging slowly 2 Walking upstairs and downstairs slowly 3 Slowly sit in a half height chair, wait a moment, and up slowly 4 Slowly sit in a low height chair, wait a moment, and up slowly 5 Sitting a moment, trying to get up, and collapse into a chair 6 Sitting a moment, lying slowly, wait a moment, and sit again 7 Being on one's back change to lateral position, wait a moment, and change to one's back 8 Standing, slowly bending at knees, and getting up 9 Standing, slowly bending without bending knees, and getting up 10 Standing, get into a car, remain seated and get out of the car Import In order to import the dataset, you just need to type: import numpy as np dataset = np.load('SisFall-reduced.npy')
docs.title: SisFall

docs.text: UCI-HAR UCI-HAR Datasets Guide UCI-HAR is a dataset for Human Activity Recognition ( HAR ), sampled at 50Hz containing accelerometer and gyroscope data. The following files contains data obtained by 30 subjects. Activities Label Activity 0 Walking 1 Walking Upstairs 2 Walking Downstairs 3 Sitting 4 Standing 5 Laying Dataset Files All data is represented as float64 Each record is composed as follows: UCI-HAR-Full.npy Total Acc. Body Acc. Gyroscope Label Subject x - y - z x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id UCI-HAR.npy Total Acc. Gyroscope Label Subject x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id Import In order to import the dataset, you just need to type: import numpy as np dataset = np.load('UCI-HAR-Full.npy') # or dataset = np.load('UCI-HAR.npy')

docs.text: realWorld2016 realWorld2016 Datasets Guide realWorld2016 is a dataset for Human Activity Recognition ( HAR ), sampled at 50Hz containing accelerometer and gyroscope data. The following file contains data obtained by 15 subjects. Each record is composed by: Accelerometer Gyroscope Label Subject Age Gender Height Weight x - y - z x - y - z label-id subject-id age gender height weight All data is represented as float64 The dataset file realWorld2016.npy Label Activity 0 Standing 1 Lying 2 Sitting 3 Jumping 4 Climbing Up 5 Climbing Down 6 Walking 7 Running Import In order to import the dataset, you just need to type: import numpy as np dataset = np.load('realWorld2016.npy')
